fchen

Class PrefixBasedOutsourcing

  • java.lang.Object
    • fchen.PrefixBasedOutsourcing

  • public class PrefixBasedOutsourcing
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the prefix-based scheme for verifiable file outsorucing. The basic idea is to separate all possible filenames into two sets: one includes all existing filenames; the other contains all other possible filenames using wildcard representation of strings.
    Author:
    Chen, Fei, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, The Chinese University of Hong Kong., Email: chenfeiorange@163.com, Webpage: https://sites.google.com/site/chenfeiorange/, Final Modifying Date: 2013.04.17

    • Field Detail

      • SPECIAL_PREVIOUS

        public static final java.lang.String SPECIAL_PREVIOUS
        SPECIAL_PREVIOUS = "@"; It is a special symbol, denoting that a queried filename is a prefix of some existing file. SPECIAL_AFTER = "#"; It is a special symbol, denoting that a queried filename is different from all existing files. Note that "#" lies behind the first place where the queried filename is different.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SPECIAL_AFTER

        public static final java.lang.String SPECIAL_AFTER
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrefixBasedOutsourcing

        public PrefixBasedOutsourcing(java.lang.String rootDirectory)
        It constructs an object dealing with all files in a directory. Initialization work is also done, including setting up the HMAC-SHA256 parameters. The key for the MAC algorithm is fixed in the class. You can also change it by modifying the source codes.
        Parameters:
        rootDirectory - The directory for all the files to be outsourced.

    • Method Detail

      • print

        public void print()
        It prints out the information about the existing file set, the prefix set and their MACs.

      • outsource

        public void outsource()
        It helps the client outsource all the possible files to the cloud, including both the files and their MACs.

      • query

        public java.lang.String query(java.lang.String filename)
        It helps the client send a query to the cloud.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file to be queried.
        Returns:
        A token that is sent to the cloud. The token depends on the protocol. It could be the original filename; it also could be an encrypted version of the original filename.

      • search

        public ProofData search(java.lang.String filename)
        It helps the cloud search a filename which is queried by the client.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file to be queried.
        Returns:
        A proof data object which has three variables: an integer indicator, a string and a byte array. The second is the query filename and the third is the MAC of the filename. The first means as follows: '0' denotes failure. '1' denotes the query file exists in the current file set; '2' denotes the query file is a prefix of some existing file. '3' denotes the query file is different from all existing files.

      • verify

        public int verify(java.lang.String filename,
         ProofData proof)
        It helps a client verify whether the returned result from the cloud is correct.
        Parameters:
        filename - The queried file.
        proof - The proof object that the cloud returns.
        Returns:
        An integer indicating whether search is successful and whether the cloud cheats. '0' denotes search failure; '1' denotes a verifiable search; '2' denotes the cloud cheats.

      • getRandomExistingFile

        public java.lang.String getRandomExistingFile()
        It generates a random existing filename. This function is mainly for performance evaluation purpose.
        Returns:
        A random existing filename.

        A random non-existing filename.
